result.execSummary:
The defendant Theodore A Harkness was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Theodore A Harkness in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense proceeds to sentencing on Cts. 1 and 2.

Court orders the following:
Ct 1:
- 6 months jail straight time concurrent to Ct. 2 STAYED for 1 year Probation - concurrent 
- Court Costs of $343.00 (includes DV Surcharge) to be paid as a Condition of Probation - apply any bail 
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of  Probation:   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No contact with Kevin L. or Valerie T. or any other residences.  Anger management. 
- Defendant to perform 30 hours of community service as a Condition of Probation.
- 10 days jail Condition Time (nonworking hours)  STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight time to be used at the Agents discretion. 

Ct  2:
- 6 months jail straight time concurrent to Ct. 1 STAYED for 1 year Probation - concurrent 
- Court Costs of $343.00 (includes DV Surcharge) to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of  Probation:   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No contact with Kevin L. or Valerie T. or any other residences.  Anger management.
Sentencing hearing on July 27, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Theodore A Harkness in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Schleis states he is not the Attorney of record from the Public Defender's Office. Atty. Schleis requests another date for sentencing. Atty. Schleis states he may represent the defendant on the next date. Court will give another date in 2 - 3 weeks for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on July 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
